DataElement.preferredName: Minimal Residual Disease Aberrant Phenotype Lower Limit of Detection Laboratory Procedure Outcome 1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the minimal residual disease aberrant phenotype lower limit of detection in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Minimal Residual Disease Aberrant Phenotype Lower Limit of Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques._The expression of traits associated with a disease or abnormality, or the loss of expression of traits associated with a normal or healthy phenotype._The smallest concentration of an analyte that can be determined with a stated precision or confidence.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: remainder of a tumor or a neoplasm/cancer after primary, potentially curative therapy.

Concepts.definition: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Property.preferredDefinition: The expression of traits associated with a disease or abnormality, or the loss of expression of traits associated with a normal or healthy phenotype.:The smallest concentration of an analyte that can be determined with a stated precision or confidence.

Concepts.definition: The expression of traits associated with a disease or abnormality, or the loss of expression of traits associated with a normal or healthy phenotype.
The smallest concentration of an analyte that can be determined with a stated precision or confidence.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2022.10.3 Released per ticket request CADSR0001568. ak

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
